uk.gov.gchq.palisade.example.client

Class ExampleConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.example.client.ExampleConfigurator

  • public final class ExampleConfigurator
extends Object
    Convenience class for the examples to configure the config creation service. This is used to create an entire configuration for Palisade for the examples from scratch.

    • Method Summary

        Allows the creation of some configuration data for the single JVM example.

      • setupMultiJVMConfigurationService

        public static ConfigurationService setupMultiJVMConfigurationService(List<String> etcdEndpoints,
                                                                     Optional<AuditService> containerAudit,
                                                                     Optional<PolicyService> containerPolicy,
                                                                     Optional<UserService> containerUser,
                                                                     Optional<ResourceService> containerResource,
                                                                     Optional<PalisadeService> containerPalisade,
                                                                     Optional<CacheService> containerCache)
        Allows the bootstrapping of some configuration data for the multi-JVM examples. This can be used by the multi JVM examples, including the containerised examples. If no etcd endpoints are given, then a hashmap cache backing store is created and services are told to use that. This is useful in the integration tests. If an endpoint is given, then this will be used instead. The containerisedCache argument is the cache service details that will be put into the configuration given to various services when they startup. This may need to be different to the cache used on the client side, due to changes in how containers contact other containers, e.g. different host names in network URLs.
        Parameters:
        etcdEndpoints - the list of etcd end points, if empty then a HashMap backing store is used
        containerAudit - the AuditService that services should be told to use once they start
        containerPolicy - the PolicyService that services should be told to use once they start
        containerResource - the ResourceService that services should be told to use once they start
        containerUser - the UserService that services should be told to use once they start
        containerPalisade - the PalisadeService that service should be told to use once they start
        containerCache - the CacheService that services should be told to use once they start (potentially inside containers)
        Returns:
        the configuration service to provide the Palisade entry point
